page.title: 20HOUSING IN GT. WAKERING
page.content: THERE ARE MANY KINDS OF HOUSES. A SEMI-DETACHED HOUSE IS JOINED ON ONE SIDE. A TERRACE HOUSE IS ONE OF A LONG LINE OF HOUSES JOINED TOGETHER. A DETACHED HOUSE STANDS BY ITS SELF. ALL THESE HOUSES HAVE AT LEAST TWO FLOORS. A BUNGELOW HAS ONE. MOST HOUSES HAVE TILE OR SLATE ROOFS. A FEW COTTAGES HAVE THATCHED ROOFS WHICH ARE MADE OF REEDS.SOME PEOPLE LIVE IN FLATS. A FLAT IS A SET OF ROOMS IN A MULTI STOREY BUILDING. MOST HOUSES HAVE GAS AND ELECTRICITY SUPPLIES FOR HEATING, LIGHTING AND COOKING.ALSO IN A HOUSE WE WOULD EXPECT TO GET HOT AND COLD RUNNING WATER. MOST HOUSES HAVE A BATHROOM AND TOILET AND THREE BEDROOMS. THE AVERAGE SIZE FAMILY LIVING IN SUCH A HOUSE WOULD BE THREE OR FOUR.THERE ARE THREE SPECIAL BLOCKS OF FLATS WITH WARDENS FOR OLD PEOPLE IN OUR VILLAGE.
